description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY SIDE EXTENSION.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.  Reason for condition: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The flat roof area of the extension/building hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony or sitting out area.  Reason for condition: To protect the privacy and amenities of the occupiers of adjoining residential properties.

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the external surfaces of the building/extension shall be those specified in the approved drawing no. (12/93/36) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced.  Reason for condition: To ensure a satisfactory appearance for the development.

Condition : 4 - The extension hereby permitted shall remain in residential use, ancillary to the main residential use of the property.  Reason: To safeguard the amenities of adjoining residential occupiers.
